DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Outcome Patient-Centered Communication in Cancer Care-Long Form Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._A self-report questionnaire for cancer patients that assesses how well health care professionals are communicating with their patients. It consists of 36 items in six domains, each scored using a five point Likert scale._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._A self-report questionnaire for cancer patients that assesses how well health care professionals are communicating with their patients. It consists of 36 items in six domains, each scored using a five point Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredName: Patient-Centered Communication in Cancer Care-Long Form
Property.preferredDefinition: A self-report questionnaire for cancer patients that assesses how well health care professionals are communicating with their patients. It consists of 36 items in six domains, each scored using a five point Likert scale.

Concepts.longName: Patient-Centered Communication in Cancer Care-Long Form
Concepts.definition: A self-report questionnaire for cancer patients that assesses how well health care professionals are communicating with their patients. It consists of 36 items in six domains, each scored using a five point Likert scale.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease
